parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To expect, wait for, await, think, anticipate. From pros and dokeuo; to anticipate; by implication, to await.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To hasten, urge on, desire earnestly. Probably strengthened from pous; to 'speed', i.e. Urge on; by implication, to await eagerly.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
From the present participle of pareimi; a being near, i.e. Advent; physically, aspect.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Feminine Singular

str2: Perhaps from the same as oros; the sky; by extension, heaven; by implication, happiness, power, eternity; specially, the Gospel.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Passive - 3rd Person Plural
Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From pur; to kindle, i.e. to be ignited, glow, be refined, or to be inflamed.
Neuter of a presumed derivative of the base of stoicheo; something orderly in arrangement, i.e. a serial constituent, proposition.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To make liquid; pass: I melt (away). Apparently a primary verb; to liquefy.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Neuter Plural
str2: To burn with great heat. From kausis; to set on fire.
